required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High-flow Nasal Cannula Oxygenation Decrease Hypoxia in Gastroscopy Sedated by Propofol
clinical_study.official_title: High-flow Nasal Cannula Oxygenation Decrease Hypoxia in Gastroscopy Sedated by Propofol: a Randomized Multicentre Clinical Trial

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Pudong New Area People's Hospital
Shanghai Tongji Hospital, Tongji University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Hypoxia is the most common adverse events during sedated gastroscopy. In present study, high-flow nasal cannula oxygenation will be utilized in order to reduce the hypoxia. At the same time the feasibility and safety will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 2 hours

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 2 hours
Patients will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: (SpO2 < 75% for any duration or 75% ≤ SpO2 < 90% for >/=60 s)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Other adverse events include other adverse events recorded by tools proposed by the World Society of Intravenous Anesthesia International Sedation Task Force and HFNC supportive oxygen therapy-related adverse events.

arm_group.description: Oxygen(up to 60L/min) supplied with high-flow nasal cannula

intervention.description: Oxygen is supplied with a high-flow nasal cannula oxygenation device，the flow is up to 60L/min

facility.name: Renji hospital, School of Medicine, Shanghai Jiaotong University
Shanghai Pudong New Area People's Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice Chair of the Department of Anesthesiology
